title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Hello welcome! ’m data scientist educator ’s especially passionate using visualization facilitate communication statistical learning. ’m particularly motivated elegance power “Grammar Graphics” framework, exploring empower ggplot2 users take advantage extension space 1) working new extension packages statistical education 2) providing new points entry ggplot2 world (tutorials/recipes well community building). last three years, ’ve worked Dean’s Data Cell United States Military Academy West Point data analytics teaching dual role. taught statistical methodology University Denver’s Josef Korbel School International Studies Visiting Teaching Assistant Professor lectured Technische Universität Dresden’s Center International Studies consulted project Violence Prevention Research Program University California Davis. PhD University Illinois, dissertation won 2018 Burkholder Award Best Dissertation Political Science department University Illinois. study effectiveness international institutions law especially area security. broadly, areas study International Relations, Methodology, Comparative Politics emphasis Latin American Politics. dissertation focused compliance supranational law, using UN Security Council resolutions principle case; conducted dissertation field research Brazil Federal House Deputies. extensive experience data analysis teaching data science. worked statistics consultant, Applied Technologies Arts Science (ATLAS), University Illinois 2013-2015. also served “Methods TA” Political Science 2015-2016 academic year University Illinois, providing assistance expertise undergraduate graduate students. TU Dresden, 2018, designed taught course introducing students data science tools statistical analysis political research. primarily teach methodology data science courses Korbel School. Research interests methodology include communicating uncertainty, visual exposition statistical concepts electoral rules. awarded Fulbright Fellowship (Argentina 2008), Foreign Language Area Studies Fellowships (2009-2011), Nelle Signor Travel Fellowship (Brazil 2011) participated specialized workshops including Empirical Implications Theoretical Models (2010), Public Policy Nuclear Threats (2013), Berkeley Institute Transparency Social Sciences (2015) workshops, Zurich Summer School Women Political Methodology (2017), Lorentz Workshop: Empirical Research International Organizations (2018). Previously academic career, worked U.S. Department Commerce’s Bureau Industry Security chemical biological export controls worked lithium-ion battery failure diagnostics Chemical Engineering Division Argonne National Laboratory.
